00066   struct ClassPoint
00067   {
00068       const char *id;
00069       // Specialization points to match, in order: Stealth, Combat, Magic
00070       // Note: Order is taken from http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Morrowind:Class_Quiz
00071       unsigned int points[3];

00143        through script commands. You can manipulate this through using

00173     void setMode(GuiMode newMode)
00174     {
00175       if (newMode==GM_Inventory && allowed==GW_None)
00176         return;
00177 
00178       mode = newMode;
00179       updateVisible();
00180     }
00181     void setNextMode(GuiMode newMode);

00183     GuiMode getMode() const { return mode; }
00184 
00185     // Everything that is not game mode is considered "gui mode"
00186     bool isGuiMode() const { return getMode() != GM_Game; }
00187 
00188     // Disallow all inventory mode windows
00189     void disallowAll()
00190     {
00191       allowed = GW_None;
00192       updateVisible();
00193     }
00194 
00195     // Allow one or more windows
00196     void allow(GuiWindow wnd)
00197     {
00198       allowed = (GuiWindow)(allowed | wnd);
00199       updateVisible();
00200     }

00313   template<typename T>
00314   void WindowManager::removeDialog(T*& dialog)
00315   {
00316       OEngine::GUI::Layout *d = static_cast<OEngine::GUI::Layout*>(dialog);
00317       removeDialog(d);
00318       dialog = 0;
00319   }
